value.halfverse:
for the mouth of the wicked,
 the mouth of the deceitful, is opened against me.
value.verse: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise; *

value.halfverse:
they encompass me with hateful words
 and fight against me without a cause.
value.verse: They speak to me with a lying tongue; *
Despite my love, they accuse me; *
value.halfverse: but as for me, I pray for them.
and hatred for my love.
value.verse: They repay evil for good, *
Set a wicked man against him, *
value.halfverse: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
and let his appeal be in vain.
value.verse: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, *

value.halfverse: and let another take his office.
value.verse: Let his days be few, *
Let his children be fatherless, *
value.halfverse: and his wife become a widow.

value.verse: Let his children be waifs and beggars; *
value.halfverse: let them be driven from the ruins of their homes.

value.verse: Let the creditor seize everything he has; *
value.halfverse: let strangers plunder his gains.
and none to pity his fatherless children.
value.verse: Let there be no one to show him kindness, *

value.halfverse: and his name be blotted out in the next generation.
value.verse: Let his descendants be destroyed, *
Let the wickedness of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and his mother’s sin not be blotted out;

value.verse: Let their sin be always before the LORD; *
value.halfverse: but let him root out their names from the earth;

value.verse: Because he did not remember to show mercy, *
value.halfverse:
but persecuted the poor and needy
 and sought to kill the brokenhearted.

value.verse:
He loved cursing,
let it come upon him; *
value.halfverse:
he took no delight in blessing,
 let it depart from him.

let it soak into his body like water
 and into his bones like oil;
value.verse: He put on cursing like a garment, *
Let it be to him like the cloak which he wraps around himself, *
value.halfverse: and like the belt that he wears continually.
and to those who speak evil against me.
value.verse: Let this be the recompense from the LORD to my accusers, *

But you, O Lord my God,
oh, deal with me according to your Name; *
value.halfverse: for your tender mercy’s sake, deliver me.

value.verse: For I am poor and needy, *
value.halfverse: and my heart is wounded within me.

value.verse: I have faded away like a shadow when it lengthens; *
value.halfverse: I am shaken off like a locust.
and my flesh is wasted and gaunt.
value.verse: My knees are weak through fasting, *

value.halfverse: they see and shake their heads.
value.verse: I have become a reproach to them; *

value.halfverse: save me for your mercy’s sake.
value.verse: Help me, O LORD my God; *

value.halfverse: that you, O LORD, have done it.
value.verse: Let them know that this is your hand, *
They may curse, but you will bless; *
value.halfverse:
let those who rise up against me be put to shame,
 and your servant will rejoice.

value.verse: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace *
value.halfverse: and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.
in the midst of the multitude will I praise him;
value.verse: I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth; *

value.halfverse: to save his life from those who would condemn him.
value.verse: Because he stands at the right hand of the needy, *
